definition: to spin/to whirl around
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)

sentences.english: Tail is docked and well set on, carried gaily but never over the back.
sentences.chinese: 斷尾，歡快地舉着，但決不能翻卷在背上。

sentences.english: Ulcer edge appears to" roll over" into the defect and is a tough fibrinous ring.
sentences.chinese: 潰瘍邊緣“翻卷”進入凹陷處，形成一堅硬的纖維環。

sentences.english: Smoke was still curling out of shattered third-floor windows.
sentences.chinese: 從三樓破爛的窗口仍不斷冒出濃煙向上翻卷。

sentences.english: Slowly the waves rolled towards the row of homes.
sentences.chinese: 海浪翻卷着，緩緩地朝着一排家園湧去。
翻卷着的薄棉紙疊成的花環。

sentences.english: Rolled with the whitecaps, gurgling sound of water, secluded orchid in a deserted Valley, indulge in self-admiration.
sentences.chinese: 翻卷着的白浪，淙淙的流水聲，空谷幽蘭，孤芳自賞。

sentences.english: A door shuts with a bang and curtains billow into the room.
sentences.chinese: 房門砰地一聲關上了，窗簾被風翻卷着吹向屋內。

sentences.english: The mighty torrent rushing through the swirl of history rolled.
sentences.chinese: 浩蕩的洪流衝過歷史翻卷的漩渦。

sentences.english: The only things moving are swirls of snow.
sentences.chinese: 翻卷的雪是唯一動着的事物。

definition: variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
great waves/billows
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
gale/squall/whole gale (meteorology)
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to split open/to split apart
to float/to drift
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
ocean wave/billows
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to roll/to boil
wave
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
to splash/to spatter
